alert.note: Alert for Frenchman Basin (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Red Flag Warning issued October 22 at 9:48AM CDT until October 22 at 8:00PM CDT by NWS NorthPlatte
info.description: ...RED FLAG WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 8 PM CDT THIS EVENING FOR GUSTY WINDS AND VERY LOW HUMIDITY FOR FIRE WEATHER ZONE 210... ...RED FLAG WARNING IS NOW ALSO IN EFFECT FROM NOON TO 7 PM CDT SUNDAY FOR GUSTY WINDS AND LOW HUMIDITY FOR FIRE WEATHER ZONE 210... The National Weather Service in North Platte has upgraded the Fire Weather Watch to a Red Flag Warning from noon to 7 PM CDT Sunday. * AFFECTED AREA...Fire Weather Zone 210 Frenchman Basin. * TIMING...Saturday Noon to 8 PM CDT, Sunday from Noon to 7 PM CDT. * WINDS...South 10 to 15 mph with gusts to 25 mph for Saturday. Southwest 20 to 30 mph with gusts to 40 mph for Sunday. * RELATIVE HUMIDITY...Around 10 percent Saturday. As low as 15 percent Sunday. * TEMPERATURES...Highs in the lower to mid 80s each day. * LIGHTNING...Not anticipated. * IMPACTS...Any fire start will likely spread rapidly and be very difficult to control. Extreme fire behavior is possible due to winds Sunday.
info.instruction: A Red Flag Warning means that critical fire weather conditions are either occurring now, or will shortly. A combination of strong winds, low relative humidity, and warm temperatures can contribute to extreme fire behavior.
